verses.roman:
āsthitasya paraṁ dharmaṁ
kṛṣṇasya gṛha-medhinām
āsan ṣoḍaśa-sāhasraṁ
mahiṣyaś ca śatādhikam

synonyms: āsthitasya—who was situated in; param—the highest; dharmam—religious principles; kṛṣṇasya—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; gṛha-medhinām—of those in the household order of life; āsan—there were; ṣoḍaśa—sixteen; sāhasram—thousand; mahiṣyaḥ—queens; ca—and; śata—one hundred
translation: While fulfilling the highest standards of religious householder life, Lord Kṛṣṇa maintained more than 16,100 wives.
